summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, instructing a contractor to download attachments related to subpoena returns from AIC Title Service for inclusion in a Rule 16 production. It indicates ongoing legal discovery and document production in a case.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District Of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, instructing a contractor to handle subpoena returns from AIC Title Service for a legal production.

events.title: Email Instruction for Subpoena Returns
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails a contractor to download attachments as subpoena returns from AIC Title Service and prepare them for the next Rule 16 production.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District Of New York

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email dated October 11, 2021, concerning legal discovery procedures.
It references subpoena returns from an entity called 'AIC Title Service'.
The instructions are for preparing documents for a 'Rule 16 production', which is part of criminal procedure governing discovery.
The correspondence originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, indicating their involvement in a case requiring this discovery.
The email is addressed to a contractor, showing the use of external personnel for document handling in the legal process.
